title: One-way function
summary: In computer science, a one-way function is a function that is easy to compute on every input, but hard to invert given the image of a random input.  Here, "easy" and "hard" are to be understood in the sense of computational complexity theory, specifically the theory of polynomial time problems. Not being one-to-one is not considered sufficient for a function to be called one-way (see Theoretical definition, below).
